summary: Simon thanks Noxy.

summary: Simon posts first Hytale Legacy screenshot
mainText:
'Hytale legacy engine is back.

Here is the first screenshot of its return.
More screenshots will be posted on @Hytale

Original vision is back.
We are back home.' by Simon

(Official notes from Simon on the Hytale Discord:

Zone 3, Shadow Knight (Temporary Name)
 
- DoF is on for this screenshot
- Doesn't have a spawn or purpose yet, just looks cool and I wanted to share. Modders can do whatever with it.
- We have plans to make it a late game boss fight, no work done on it yet, too busy fixing game as a whole.)

summary: Simon says he'll record raw footage, share it today.
mainText:
'PSA: I don't want to spend too much time making clips or marketing myself, so I'll be recording raw footage this morning, and I'll dumb it here when I'm done later today, bugs and all. I need to get back to work on what matters: fixing the game. Set your expectations low; the game is broken. Not good. It's our mission to make it good and then do our best to make it great over the years to come.

My social media team will be sharing screenshots and clips in the coming hours and days. Blog posts are in the works as well.

Time to LOCK IN and get ready for early access.' by Simon

summary: Screenshots/clips/art can be monetized on YouTube
mainText: 'You can monetize all of our screenshots/clips/art on YouTube. Make content, have fun.' by Simon

summary: Simon says Saving and Releasing Hytale are the most important steps/promises.
mainText:
'What matters is the promises I made to the players: Save Hytale, release Hytale and make it good.

We are now working on step 2: release Hytale.' by Simon

summary: Hytale shared Zone 4 Burned Skeleton

(Info from the Hytale Discord by BuddhaCat:

Zone 4 Burned Skeleton (WIP name)
- Like the Shadow Knight (above), DoF was used in this screenshot
- Intended to be a challenging/higher tier skeleton for players to fight
- As with all of our NPCs, modders can use this enemy however they see fit!)

summary: Slikey discusses height limit, cubic chunks.
mainText:
'100% Covering that, I cant reply to all tweets but already telling you that we currently have a height limit right now at 320 blocks. We didn't know better in 2016. No promise on timeline for revisiting this but we believe in @thinkofdeath who has already done lots of improvements in our voxel storage tech and he ain't done yet.
' by Slikey

(For reference: Minecraft's height limit extends from -64 to 320 (totalling 384 blocks))

summary: Simon shares first look at Creation Tools tab in Hytale.
mainText:
'A new tab called Creation Tools is now in Hytale to help you explore what is possible as a creator.
Ô∏ÄÔ∏Ä
Ô∏ÄÔ∏ÄFrom simple NPC spawning to complex World Gen Editor.
Ô∏ÄÔ∏Ä
Ô∏ÄÔ∏ÄThe vision for modding in Hytale is simple: keep it beginner-friendly, easy to learn, and part of the game itself. You can stick to basic tools or go deeper with advanced ones, like the World Gen Editor, which lets you control whole-world generation. A blog on that is coming soon.
Ô∏ÄÔ∏Ä
Ô∏ÄÔ∏ÄMore updates for creators are in the works!' by Simon

(First look at Creation Tools; Asset Editor, Model Editor, Worldgen Editor, World Tools, Builder Tools, Machinima, etc.

World Tools includes: Prefab Editor, Prefab List, Spawn NPC, Spawn Particle, Change Player Model, Tint Chunk, and Instances.)

summary: Simon teases Updated Kweebecs spawning in a different place.

'@crispacorn Adding them soon, just got the files.
They will spawn in a different place‚Ä¶ you will soon learn.' by Simon

("Updated Kweebecs" refers to the redesigned Kweebecs that were created under Riot Games)

summary: Simon confirms Hytale will be using Blockbench
mainText: 'Hytale will be using Blockbench going forward ' by Simon

summary: Simon confirms everything can be edited while the game/server is running.
mainText:
'@PirateSoftware Yes, and all of this can be edited while the game/server is running.' by Simon

(This means custom items, item/monster logic, particle effects, and more can be edited while the game/server is running.)

summary: Simon discusses revenue split with mods/servers.
mainText:
'Hytale will take 0% from modders and server owners for at least the first 2 years.

We will trust that they bring us players; that is all.

We will not have any exclusivity clauses.

By the players, for the players.' by Simon

summary: Simon says in-game discovery of mods is post-launch goal.
mainText: 'After launch we will work on discovery in-game.' by Simon

summary: Polina responds to burning mosshorns

mainText: 'genau!' by Polina

summary: Simon talks about free/paid mods, % cuts
mainText:
'I suspect that many mods will be free. We will allow authors to enable purchases so players can support their work if they wish to. Maybe even allow authors to have a system where they can give for free and let users pick a price, like itch io.

Not taking a % means we are more likely to feature free mods, unlike other platforms.. We will be fairer and less driven by shareholders seeking to push income by only featuring the highest-revenue generator.

Give us some time to figure everything out and making it fair to both creators and players :)' by Simon

working on itüòÖ' by Simon

summary: Hytale posts 16 minutes of gameplay footage.
mainText:
'16+ minutes of brand new gameplay footage. A taste of things to come. Enjoy, Cursebreakers ‚ù§Ô∏è #Hytale' by Hytale

(Simon on Discord: I promised players videos, screenshots and blog posts. One day after the acquisition, I‚Äôm keeping that promise. Now that you‚Äôve seen the first gameplay footage in a long time, I‚Äôm heading back to work on the early access launch. The team will share more clips and screenshots as we go.
It mattered to me to release raw footage today so we break the curse once and for all.)

summary: Simon provides brief statement on gameplay.
mainText:
'Recorded and edited this morning by me, just raw, random footage. I mean, I even forgot to mute my mic so you can hear me clicküòÖ

Keep in mind, Hytale is incomplete and buggy, but still beautiful and fun. We have a lot of work to make this a good game, but I believe in my team. The progress we have made in the last few weeks has been incredible.

I made three promises;

1. Save Hytale
2. Release more videos/screenshots
3. Launch Hytale

We are now working on promise #3

See you soon.' by Simon

summary: Simon says stack size will be increased.
mainText:
'Yeah I made a ticket for it, it's gonna get updated soon :)' by Simon

(Was 50)

summary: Simon shows how stack size is easy to configure
mainText:
'Super easy to configure. You can make it 1000+ if you want.

Look.

Hit save, and it auto updates in-game, no restart required.' by Simon

summary: DSN responds to HytaleNews post about Map

summary: Slikey explains something to do with mods and plugins and BungeeCord idk
mainText: 'Taking it in for the events and permissions - BungeeCord we replaced with a transfer packet that allows you to send players to other server + a small payload so you can add tokens / encrypted data for transport.' by Slikey

summary: World Size will be handled in Worldgen blogpost
mainText: 'Will be handled in worldgen post' by Slikey

summary: Simon says enemy encounters aren't fully configured yet
mainText:
'They are not configured yet, look how some skeletons are smarter than the others.
Got someone on fixing it!

Will showcase later on' by Simon

summary: Simon provides long notes on gameplay footage.
mainText:
'Please note that this gameplay is unfinished, raw footage recorded this morning. 

It's missing many NPC configs (which is why some are just auto-attacking). 
The overlay for wood cutting is too dark, and wood cutting in general is too fast for the Iron tier.
The bow was basically in debug mode and gave signature moves for every attack. 
The NPCs are not balanced yet in terms of HP/DMG and other stats.
The weather with the biome transitions is not good.
Countless bugs.
I didn't include crafting/cozy because I didn't prepare this video at all, I just recorded on the fly; we will post something more cozy/living world later.
and the list goes on and on.
The character sheet UI is temporary.
The portal at the end is unfinished, but I decided to put it anyway.
The gun near the end sounds weird, but it was a funny meme to put on.
Missing NPCs in many zones.
I have over 100 notes from this video.

Working on it, fixing it all.' by Simon

summary: Simon answers a slew of questions about the state of the game.
mainText:
'1. no campaign
2. only 4 zones at the moment but a surprise soon
3. ocean is there but lackluster
4. Some boss but broken, not sure if time to fix before EA
5. No magic system per say, just some magic items like a wand, totems and such - limited but will be expanded later after EA' by Simon

summary: Simon gives details on current steps to release.
mainText:
'Working on locking down the release date ASAP. We currently need to run hardware tests, wrap up legal docs, stabilize the game and fix a few security issues.

I‚Äôll have a precise answer by the end of next week. Pre-orders, name reservation and account creation will begin as well. All pricing will be announced, FYI base edition under $30 USD.

We are almost home.' by Simon

summary: Simon confirms players can upgrade from one edition to a higher edition.
mainText: 'Yeah' by Simon

summary: Players can set up dedicated servers at launch.
mainText: 'Yes' by Simon

summary: Simon gives details on localization

summary: Simon on controller support
mainText: 'Not yet' by Simon

summary: Simon says FOV controls will exist.
mainText: 'Yes' by Simon

summary: Simon explains his pricing thoughts
mainText:
'For transparency, I‚Äôm trying to keep the base price as low as possible so more of you can play Hytale. At the same time, I need to factor in the buyback price, legal fees, and production costs.

I‚Äôm not going to recoup what I put into this for a long time, even with all the renewed attention and that‚Äôs fine. Don‚Äôt worry about me, let‚Äôs take care of the team first.' by Simon

summary: Simon says user is underestimating how much $ he put into saving Hytale
mainText: 'You are underestimating how much I put into this üòÇ' by Simon

summary: Simon explains that there is no campaign; who E.A. is for.
mainText:
'There is no campaign. This is early access exploration mode, its barebone and not good yet!

Early access is meant for those who support the original vision to keep going forward with adventure mode and everything else shown in the trailer.' by Simon

summary: Simon says 90% of the beta signups were lost in acquisitions, but there won't be a beta so it doesn't matter.

'90%+ of the emails were lost in the acquisition. Unfortunately, there are no solutions because of how regulation works.

However, there is no beta, we are going straight up to early access :P
Doesn't matter anymore, except for those who don't know about the recent news, so we will ask our community to spread the word when the time comes.' by Simon

summary: Simon says next week is testing week, with a release date by the end of the week. Pricing details tomorrow.
mainText:
'Starting next week, we will test Hytale across different hardware to determine the minimum specs, fix major crashes, improve overall security, test the launcher and finish up legal work to get the game ready for early access.

By the end of that week, we will announce a precise release date.

Tomorrow, we will announce Hytale pricing details

Later today, 
@slikey_dev
  will post a blog about modding!' by Simon

summary: Polina says particle system logic is pretty standard

summary: Slikey shares the Hytale Modding Strategy and Status Blog!
mainText: 'Hytale Modding Strategy and Status Blog is live. Excited to hear what you think about vision we have for modding in Hytale.  https://hytale.com/news/2025/11/hytale-modding-strategy-and-status' by Slikey

summary: Polina confirms there are settings to change VFX anchors
mainText: 'yep' by Polina

summary: Simon says no new trailer for now
mainText: 'I don't think so, just posting footage stuff for now' by Simon

summary: Slikey says Hytale will follow UE's approach
mainText: 'Yes. In Unreal Engine you use C++ and Blueprints in tandem - C++ code is used to make more blueprint nodes available. Hytale will follow the same approach and you use Java plugins to make unlock more nodes in our visual scripting.' by Slikey

summary: Hytale tweets the new blogpost
mainText:
'In this new blog post, Technical Director, Slikey, gives us a transparent and in-depth look of where Hytale modding stands today and its future. #Hytale 
https://hytale.com/news/2025/11/hytale-modding-strategy-and-status
' by Hytale

summary: Polina responds to Simon's poop tweet
mainText: 'ü•≤ yep' by Polina

summary: Propzie recognizes the raptor...
mainText: 'Hay that raptor looks familiarü§î' by Propzie

summary: Slikey talks about the artstyle "rules"
mainText: 'Pretty much yes. Our art team can probably explain it better but we believe some limitations maintain a healthy art style and performance. We dream of an Orbis that has an artstyle the community can achieve and add to so that mods are immersive and seamless.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey discusses bulletpoint prominence in blogpost
mainText: ' Can't help myself  I love to communicate with the community but writing long texts is not what I tend to enjoy even when the topic is so exciting and close to my heart as modding.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says it is currently java, and Visual Scripting will eventually complement it.
mainText: 'Correct. It is plain old Java right now and we will bring Visual Scripting to complement this.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says SinglePlayer
mainText: 'Yes, the singleplayer spins up a local server so that you can enjoy plugins even in singleplayer. There is no difference between multiplayer and singleplayer.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says there's a lot of development to catch up on.
mainText: 'Remember it is not there yet. This is the vision, we have a lot of development to catch up on and for now it is Java plugins with Visual Scripting being introduced shortly after launch. Anything you'd be able to do in Visual Scripting is already available in Java today.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey confirms LAN support
mainText: 'As in you can invite friends into your singleplayer world? Yes.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says VisualScripting is encouraged but you can use "just Java."
mainText: 'Correct. We'd like to encourage using Visual Scripting as it is more accessible and safe to share and download but you are not forced to use it if you just want to stay in Java.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey talks about Port Forwarding
mainText: 'I'll dive into that more when I am less sleep deprived but this is usually solved using uPNP which resolves the need for port forwarding on consumer devices. Most game consoles use this and it is usually enabled by default on consumer routers. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Plug_and_Play' by Slikey

summary: Slikey discusses using "plain old Java"
mainText: 'It will be plain old Java to make plugins and compile them against our server jars as dependencies.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says he wishes he could remake Warlords minigame in Hytale
mainText: 'I wish I could remake Warlords.. Those particle effects there were fun to make because I love linear algebra but now in Hytale it would be just perfect.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says there are no plans to support custom shaders or shader mods.
mainText: 'We currently have no plans for custom shader support or shader mods. We are willing to listen though and see what you want to do. We'll find a solution.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says models can define attachment points for riders.
mainText: 'I think that is defined in the model using attachment points. I am sure you will be able to see it when you open our models and look for it üëç' by Slikey

summary: Paris is excited about modding

summary: Slikey says there is no client modding.
mainText: 'The client won't have control. The creative modders behind the server want you to have a certain experience and we want to respect those decisions. If problems arise from that, we can always revisit this.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says the Hytale Asset Editor will be released as part of the game.
mainText: 'Will be released with the game. It is part of the game.' by Slikey

summary: Slikey says post-launch goal is to solve dynamic asset streaming by using caching and CDN redirects
mainText:
'We need to solve this using caching and CDN redirects for asset pack serving. Stuff for post-launch.' by Slikey

("My biggest question right now is if there's any way of dynamic asset streaming. In Minecraft, when we had a lot of music, we would have to resort to the player connecting to a web browser, because loading a giant resource pack was simply not feasible")

summary: Slikey says the server is authoritative over mods used, with SP mods not being in MP.
mainText:
'Correct, the server is authoritative over the mods used. Your singleplayer mods are not brought into multiplayer. We try to bring far render distances directly into Hytale. We have people like JellySquid (Sodium author) work on our Renderer to never need such invasive mods.' by Slikey

("but would there be some just client mods allowed? like minecraft you can join servers that are pretty customized like wynncraft but then add mods to increase render distance, or is just none of your own mods allowed on servers?")

summary: Slikey says there is no plan to add ambiguous server modding.
mainText:
'There is currently no such functionality and no plan to add it but we are always open for feedback and the community to tell us that we are dead wrong about it. We want to see how this strategy plays out but any good strategy falls apart when hit with reality :)' by Slikey

("Will it be possible for servers to be ambiguous about certain types of mods? I expect most servers wouldn't care about something like UI, unless they're going for a very specific experience.")

summary: Slikey jokes about banner art, moving fast
mainText: 'He saved me with this banner art.. I didn't have one 20 minutes before posting and Propzie cooked this up really quick.. We are moving fast hereüòÖ' by Slikey

summary: Lots of UIs are server side
mainText:
'Yes, a lot of our UIs are server-side. Maybe 
@Ktar5 can post an example.' by Slikey

summary: Ktar posts example of serverside UI mods
mainText: 'Here's an example of what can easily be done in a few minutes with server side UI modding. In Game vs. UI Markup Asset vs. Java mod code. All work together to create a powerful server-side UI toolkit available at launch in Hytale.' by Ktar

summary: Slikey responds to accessibility concerns re: lack of client side mods.
mainText: 'I think this is a very valid concern and we have communication planned regarding accessibility and our commitment to it. We absolutely have work to do and also work with experts that can help us prioritize the work. The first step is making the game accessible. I hope we will be able to move fast here aswell and we have developers highly motivated to work on accessibility. I hope we will have a Hytale that doesn't rely on mods for accessibility.' by Slikey

summary: Oscar responds to user connecting "This is Our Tale" lyrics to Technoblade
mainText: 'Good spot. Technoblade never dies!' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar reacts to user "leaking" Hytale not being set in Canada.
mainText: 'Hey, SPOILERS' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar responds to user with meme gif
mainText: '"YES" meme gif' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar starts a thread on "This Is Our Tale" details.
mainText: 'This Is Our Tale' has so far got over 10k streams. Thank you all for listening to the song and leaving so many lovely comments! :) I've read them allüïµüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar reveals he wrote the song's lyrics a few months ago, produced it within 3 days of Hytale Saved.
mainText:
'I actually wrote the lyrics a few months ago, but when Hytale was suddenly saved I knew I had to produce the song right away, and within 3 days it was done.

I reached out to my good friends and professional colleagues Victoria and Ozzie for production support.' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar gives details on Victoria's vocals.
mainText: 'Victoria (http://vbvocalistic.com) did a fantastic job on the vocals, providing backing vocals with a full arrangement, with zero guidance on chords or anything. She gave me 3 takes and extra ad-libs to work with, fx and dry stems (150+ stems). All for a VERY reasonable price!' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar gives details on Ozzie's guitars.
mainText: 'Ozzie (@knivesatsea) recorded supporting guitars for me, also with no oversight, acoustic and electric guitars, all mix-ready to drop in. He then spent close to 8 hours mastering the track together with me to get it sounding as professional as it does. A truly epic producer.' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar details Pierre Frick's involvement
mainText: 'Finally, the night before release, I begged our UI lead Pierre (@pierre_frick) to record some last minute epic guitar shredding, which he stayed up quite late to finish for meüòÇ(merci beaucoup Pierre mon cherie).' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Oscar wraps up the thread
mainText: 'And there's the story of how the song came to be in just a matter of days. In this industry you have to be quick on your feet when it matters, and be ready to ROCK at even a moment's notice. And when the call comes you better be armed and ready to do the job.' by Oscar Garvin

summary: Propzie posts about the Raptor Mount
mainText: 'The raptor mount helped me find the location quicker for sure, those things are fast!' by Propzie

summary: Simon shares details on Slikey's QnA

Answers will be posted afterwards on the blog if you miss it.' by Simon

summary: Simon says release date revealed at end of next week.
mainText:
'End of next week we will decide and announce the precise early access release date.

Apologies if its confusing we are moving fast on multiple fronts and sometimes my tweets are all over the place!' by Simon

summary: Simon talks crafting in Hytale
mainText:
'No grid crafting in Hytale, can be easily modded in if someone care about it!

We are aiming to be different and easier when it comes to the action of crafting. The challenges will come from other places. Just making something we love to play ourselves :)' by Simon

summary: Simon talks today's news.
mainText: 'Today is pricing details and maybe some screenshots or clip' by Simon

summary: Simon gives more crafting details.
mainText:
'You haven‚Äôt seen the actual crafting yet. Its more innovative than grid crafting and more intuitive for new players.
You can upgrade the work stations and eventually expand that system into something that grounds the player to build a house or village. You will see it evolve over time and understand :)' by Simon

summary: Simon talks building
mainText:
'Yep, just finished rotations and other cool features.

Polishing up connected/smart block placement and will see what we can record for you guys.' by Simon

summary: Thomas talks tips and tutorials for Hytale Artstyle
mainText: 'You're right, and we're thinking about that. Hytale Art team will help creators to get started with Hytale Art style - through documentation and tutorials - the timeline is unclear for now but it will eventually happen üòä' by Thomas Frick

summary: Simon roasts user insulting Hytale's visuals
mainText: 'Don‚Äôt worry we are working on accessibility options for the visually impaired! Thanks for your report' by Simon

summary: Simon talks about pricing the game in Brazil
mainText: 'Brazil is important community to me, how much should it cost?' by Simon

summary: Simon talks about Hytale and Minecraft
mainText:
'Minecraft is one of the greatest game of all time, it has perfected many designs that no one appreciates.
Hytale is going in a very very different path, we are more going into adventure aspects as a core game (with modding in mind). We will not have things like Redstone for example. Magic will be part of Hytale in many aspects, very much so fantasy feeling.

Another thing is, our crafting is moreso like the games like Valheim / Terraria instead of grid crafting. So its very different and allows us to go in a different direction.

I have great respect for the people at Mojang, they have created an amazing game and community, our games will be very different, Minecraft is still one of my favourite game of all time.' by Simon

summary: Simon talks about regional pricing
mainText: 'It won‚Äôt be possible at launch but I‚Äôm working hard to lower price of game before announcement today.' by Simon

summary: Simon talks more about regional pricing.

summary: Slikey talked about plugins and ping
mainText:
'We have some systems being predicted on the client but there is work to do. I believe there is a future where visual scripts will help us to better tell the client how to predict behavior.
Then again we have a transfer packet with 4KB payload so server networks starting at 2 servers can be globally distributed and avoid high pings in the first place.' by Slikey
